SENT.plain: The complement-fixing (CF) activity of antigens from cultured Burkitt lymphoma cells was determined by using normal American sera as the source of antibody
Approximately 75% of the sera fixed complement with the positive cell lines
These lines contained the herpes-like virus detectable by electron microscopy
The content of CF antigen depended on the cell line used but appeared to be independent of the number of cells which produced Henle's immunofluorescence (IF) antigen
Only sera that reacted in the IF test also contained CF antibodies to the crude cell extracts
